page.title: 02LAW AND ORDER 2
page.content: Eventually, they decide whether the person is 'guilty' or 'not guilty' and whether they should be freed or not. All those who are{over eighteen}are allowed to come and watch. The{dock is on the right of the{spectators, with the{witness box}being on the other side. Mr. Smith, the headmaster of Towcester CE Junior School is a Magistrate. One of the things he likes most about this job is, "being able to play a part in keeping the law of this country." You are invited or asked to become a Magistrate and you have to train for between{18 months and 2 years.}There are about{48}or{49}courts held in a year and they are usually held at {10:00 a.m. on Mondays.}There are{14 Magistrates in the court and the court has{5}cells -{3}male,{1}female and{1} detention room, which is called the
